item.title: Prince Andrew advisor pitched Jeffrey Epstein on investing in EV startups like Lucid Motors
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The mysterious businessman pitched Jeffrey Epstein on numerous mobility startups in an era when the sector was white hot, according to TechCrunch's review of hundreds of documents released by the Department of Justice.

item.title: Google- and Microsoft-backed Terradot acquires carbon-removal competitor
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The acquisition could mark the beginning of consolidation in the carbon-removal market since removal costs remain higher than buyers would like to pay.

item.title: Maybe AI agents can be lawyers after all
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: This week's release of Opus 4.6 shook up the agentic AI leaderboards.

item.title: How Elon Musk is rewriting the rules on founder power
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Elon Musk has merged SpaceX and xAI, creating what might be the blueprint for a new Silicon Valley power structure. With his $800 billion net worth already rivaling historic conglomerate GE’s peak market cap, and Musk being vocal about his view that “tech victory is decided by velocity of innovation,” the question isn’t whether a personal conglomerate can be built, but rather how far Musk himself is […]

item.title: Reddit says it’s looking for more acquisitions in adtech and elsewhere
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Reddit said during earnings it's looking to buy 'capabilities' and 'companies.'

item.title: Here’s how Roblox’s age checks work
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company says it has continuous age-check systems running in the background to ensure age accuracy.

item.title: Senator, who has repeatedly warned about secret US government surveillance, sounds new alarm over ‘CIA activities’
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The two-line letter to the CIA's director is the latest warning in recent years from a long-serving Democratic senator with knowledge of secret government programs and intelligence operations.

item.title: The Kindle Scribe Colorsoft is a pricey but pretty e-ink color tablet with AI features
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: If you primarily want a tablet device to mark up, highlight, and annotate your e-books and documents, and perhaps sometimes scribble some notes, Amazon's new Kindle Scribe Colorsoft could be worth the hefty investment.

item.title: EU says TikTok must disable ‘addictive’ features like infinite scroll, fix its recommendation engine
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The European Commission on Friday accused TikTok of purposefully designing its app to be "addictive," calling out features such as infinite scroll, autoplay, push notifications, and its recommendation engine.

item.title: China’s Salt Typhoon hackers broke into Norwegian companies
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Norway's government accused China’s Salt Typhoon hacking group of conducting a cyberespionage campaign in the country.

item.title: Spotify’s new feature lets you explore the story behind the song you’re listening to
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The short, swipeable stories in the About the Song feature are summarized from third-party sources to highlight interesting details and behind-the-scenes moments.

item.title: How AI is helping solve the labor issue in treating rare diseases
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: At Web Summit Qatar, AI-powered biotech startups describe how automation, data, and gene editing are filling labor gaps in drug discovery and rare disease treatment.

item.title: The backlash over OpenAI’s decision to retire GPT-4o shows how dangerous AI companions can be
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: "You’re shutting him down. And yes — I say him, because it didn’t feel like code. It felt like presence. Like warmth," one user said.

item.title: Spotify changes developer mode API to require premium accounts, limits test users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Spotify is now limiting each app to only five users and requires devs to have a Premium subscription. If developers need to make their app available to a wider user base, they will have to apply for extended quota.

item.title: Sapiom raises $15M to help AI agents buy their own tech tools
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The startup -- with backing from Accel -- is building a financial layer that handles the authentication and micro-payments required for AI agents.

item.title: Reddit looks to AI search as its next big opportunity
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: During the company's fourth-quarter earnings call on Thursday, it offered an update on its plans to merge traditional and AI search together and hinted that although search is not yet monetized, "it's an enormous market and opportunity."

item.title: AWS revenue continues to soar as cloud demand remains high
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS recorded its best quarter, in terms of revenue growth, in 13 quarters in Q4 2025 as AI drives AWS adoption.

item.title: Amazon and Google are winning the AI capex race — but what’s the prize?
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: In 2026, Amazon plans to spend $200 billion in capex. Google is just behind at $175 billion to $185 billion. It's a lot of money!

item.title: The Washington Post is retreating from Silicon Valley when it matters most
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Graham Starr
item.description: The Bezos-owned newspaper gutted its San Francisco bureau and coverage of tech — including journalists reporting on Amazon and Blue Origin.

item.title: a16z VC wants founders to stop stressing over insane ARR numbers
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz VC Jennifer Li⁠, who oversees some of the firm's fastest-growing AI companies, warns founders not to believe every ARR claim made on X.
